questions.question: Which of the following best describes why Herodotus called Egypt the gift of the Nile?

choices.answer: Egypt was the country of many great rulers.
Egypt was temperate in its climate.
the Nile River flowed from east to west.
The Nile River brought fertility and life to the region.

questions.question: Which of the following best defines delta?

choices.answer: a ruler of a great house

questions.question: Which answer describes why cataracts both helped and harmed Egypt?

choices.answer: They protected the people of Egypt but imprisoned priests.
protected Egypt from invaders but prevented sailing on river
allowed farming to flourish but stopped animal domestication
allowed fishing to flourish but prevented farming

questions.question: How did Egyptian farmers water their crops?
Who would the people of Egypt blame for bad crops or disease?

choices.answer: the farmers whose small villages were unclean.
the mummies whose ka was disturbed.
the pharaoh who was both ruler and god.
the dynasty that was in power.

questions.question: Which answer did not cause social classes to appear during the Old Kingdom?

choices.answer: people from rich and powerful families

questions.question: Which of the following beliefs was central to Egyptian religion?
Why did the Egyptians build their pyramids to be grand and spectacular?

choices.answer: because they reflected the sun god's importance.
because they reflected a pharaoh's importance.
because they reflected the farmer's importance.
because they reflected the priest's importance.

questions.question: What factor contributed most to the growth of trade in the New Kingdom?

choices.answer: Egypt's defeat of the Sinai Peninsula.

questions.question: After the wars in the Middle Kingdom, Egypt

choices.answer: took control of all possible invasions routes.

questions.question: What job employed the most people in Egypt?
Ramses the Great is best remembered

choices.answer: for his ability as an artist.
for his untimely death at the hands of Ahmose.
as a great warrior and builder.

questions.question: How did the Rosetta Stone help scholars and historians in their study of Hieroglyphics?

choices.answer: It provided clues to Ramses' tomb.
It provided clues to Queen Hatshepsut's tomb.
It provided paintings of various creation stories.
provided a Greek text matching the early Egyptians writing.

questions.question: Which answer is not a feature you might find inside an Egyptian temple?
Why were tombs filled with art, jewelry, and other treasures?

choices.answer: the tombs were the private storage rooms of the pharaoh.
Egyptians believed tombs to be the kingdom's safest places.
Egyptians believed the dead enjoyed them in the afterlife.

questions.question: Which statement best summarizes the way people are represented in Egyptian paintings?

choices.answer: Bodies are smaller that natural size.
Upper bodies are straight on, while heads/legs are from side
Upper bodies are seen from side..heads/legs from straight on

questions.question: Whose tomb, discovered in 1922, taught us much about Egyptian burial practices and beliefs?
